td.content: shows a presence of a right upper lobe mass, along with mediastinal lymphadenopathy and multiple small pulmonary metastases
showed increased uptake in the proximal phalanx of right ring finger and likely metastatic deposits in T9 vertebrae and several ribs
showed moderately to poorly differentiated metastatic adenocarcinoma in keeping with lung origin

td.content: s:pt presents with 10 months history of severe right shoulder pain, mild shortness of breath and severe weight loss. he is a white m first mate aged 32 years. o:Height 64 in, Weight 143 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16 a:Lung Cancer p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to oncology.

s:32 YO m presents with 2 months history of mild shortness of breath. Patient reports that he never drinks alcohol smokes two pack/day of cigarettes for the past 2 years o:Height 64 in, Weight 144 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 70, Respiration 16 a:Lung Cancer p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and ordered CT chest, Bone Scan, Biopsy of the finger.
